results.title: When Harry met Sally...
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Rob Reiner and Andrew Scheinman
results.brief_description: Infamous for it’s restaurant scene that provokes the, “I’ll have what she’s having” line, this romantic comedy written by Nora Ephron follows the slowly developing relationship between Harry Burns (Billy Crystal) and Sally Albright (Meg Ryan). Harry and Sally meet in the 1970’s when they share a car trip courtesy of a mutual friend. They never run out of things to say, and Harry sticks by his proclamation that men cannot be friends with attractive women. Over the course of the next 10 years, both of them fall in and out of love, grow closer as friends, and contemplate a romantic future together when they cross the boundary between friends and lovers in a moment of emotional weakness. This film provided played a pivotal role in the renaissance of modern romantic comedy, led by Nora Ephron who went on to be involved in films such as “Sleepless in Seattle” and “You’ve got mail”, both of which featured Meg Ryan in the romantic lead. Cast also includes Carrie Fisher and Bruno Kirby.

results.title: When good neighbours get together
results.brief_description: In the USA, the farmers formed co-operative societies within the framework of the Rural Administration, with the aim of bringing electricity to very farm. The co-ops were run by the farmers themselves. This film tells the story of how four farmers, who lived in a valley four miles off the main power line, persuaded their neighbours that they too should have electricity brought to their farm. The Co-op’s Board of directors are all farmers from the district and they are made to remember that when the Co-op began it was thought that taking electricity to many of the farms was thought to be a had financial risk, because of the distance involved in getting power to their farms. Practical experience has since proved that electricity has allowed the farmers to expand and develop their farms, bringing greater financial returns; a local hospital, a sawmill: a poultry industry and more shops in the township have also resulted from the coming of electricity. The managers of the Rural Electrification Administration Co-operative Society in this district at length decide unanimously that bringing power to these four isolated farms will not only be a good risk but will add further to the districts’ resources.

results.title: When gold is green
results.brief_description: Gives a detailed picture of the care associated with tobacco growing in Ontario. Harvested by hand, typed, cured and baled by grade, the crop is marketed, and then stored for 1-3 years before being blended, cut and dehumidified during the highly mechanized process of cigarette manufacture.

results.title: When Friends Were Enemies: The Story of the Dunera Boys
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Judy Menczel
results.brief_description: In 1940, all male Germans, Austrians and Italians between 16 and 60, living in Britain, were arrested and interned as “enemy aliens”. Of these, 2542 were shipped off to Australia on the “H.M.T. Dunera”, travelling under extremely harsh conditions, their possessions and papers confiscated. Most were Jewish refugees from Hitler’s Germany and over 900 chose to stay on in Australia following their release from the internment camps in Hay and Tatura. This fascinating program focuses on the reunion of the “Dunera Boys” in Hay in 1990 where the men recall their experiences and the effect their internment had on their lives.

results.title: When does work end?
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Daphne Yarram and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daphne Yarram gives a candid account of her life, helping the abused, poor and unfortunate in her community, trying to make things better for her mob. Despite feeling satisfaction helping her community, Yarram also feels lonely and tired at times.

results.title: When Brendan met Trudy
results.creator_credit: Lynda Myles, Dendy Films, Collins Avenue, BBC Film Unit and Kieron Walsh
results.brief_description: Roddy Doyle (The Van, The Snapper, The Commitments) wrote the screenplay for this romantic comedy, set in modern day Dublin. Brendan is a shy schoolteacher, with few friends and no sex life to speak of who is obsessed with old films. He imagines himself at the centre of all his favourite roles, from “The Quiet man” to Godard’s “Breathless”. One evening whilst drinking in a local pub Brendan meets Trudy - an outgoing, vivacious and bubbly blonde - his complete opposite. Despite a disastrous first date Brendan and Trudy form an unlikely romance. Trudy’s secretive nature about her line of work leads Brendan to believe she is some kind of criminal, perhaps even a violent one. Brendan’s attempts to introduce Trudy to his snobbish family are disastrous and the pair struggle to keep their romance aflame. Characters enact scenes from Brendan’s favourite films, replete with subtitles. Part of the appeal of this film is the litany of film references and clips lifted from old movie classics. Directed by Kieron J. Walsh and starring Flora Montgomery and Peter McDonald.

results.title: When all the people play
results.brief_description: How a rural district came alive under the stimulus of a community recreation programme. Annapolis Royal, Nova Scotia, is the centre of a district of two hundred square miles. We watch the scheme gathering speed and scope, from the formation of the first committee, through the acquisitions and renovation of property and the training of district young people as leaders, to a variety of activities extending from a women’s softball team to the formation of a regional library. Join planning for recreation can open a new world of creative interest and accomplishment.

results.title: When a man loves a woman
results.creator_credit: Luis Mandoki, Touchstone Pictures, Jordan Kerner and Jon Avnet
results.brief_description: Family and marriage are put under threat when Alice’s (Meg Ryan) drinking becomes an addiction. Husband Michael (Andy Garcia), an airline pilot, is a perfectionist and finds it increasingly difficult to control his often reckless and neglectful wife. It takes an accident before Alice realises she has hit rock bottom and needs help. After attending a rehab clinic Alice finally returns home stronger, more independent and alcohol free but Michael, on the other hand, has problems adjusting to the new Alice. He prefers the needy and dependent wife. As the marriage begins to break down, Michael and Alice take the long and difficult road to recovery through counselling. Cast also includes Lauren Tom, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Tina Majorino, Mae Whitman, Ellen Burstyn.
